name: Restaurant Manas
description: A dosa is a thin, savoury crepe in South Indian cuisine made from a fermented batter of ground white gram and rice.

name: Restaurant smile
description: Chapatis go well with curries, dry sabzis or sabjis (vegetables cooked in gravy), chutneys or dal.

name: Restaurant durga
description: pizza, dish of Italian origin consisting of a flattened disk of bread dough topped with some combination of olive oil, oregano, tomato, olives, mozzarella or other cheese, and many other ingredients, baked quickly

name: Restaurant sayli
description: The mutton meat is a nutritious gold mine, including zinc for a robust immune system, the B12 vitamin for nerve function, and iron for healthy blood.

name: Restaurant nation
description: The concept of the thali meal traces back to ancient Indian traditions where different flavors (sweet, salty, bitter, sour, astringent, and spicy) were balanced to create a complete meal, believed to promote holistic health.

name: Restaurant Nisarga
description: Dhokla is a steamed snack that originated in Gujarat. It is made from gram flour or lentils. Hence, it is low in calories and fat, protein and fibre rich, and nutrient-dense. The high protein and fibre in dhokla help increase satiety and curb appetite.

name: Restaurant suma
description: Plain Paratha is a traditional Punjabi paratha that is ideal for a wholesome meal or as a healthy snack. The addition of sesame seeds boosts the nutrient content of the meal.

name: Restaurant Modern
description: The chickpeas used in golgappa are an excellent source of fibre, which can help lower cholesterol levels in the blood.

name: Restaurant Saish
description: kachoris are usually deep-fried, which means they have high levels of unhealthy fats that can contribute to increased bad cholesterol (LDL) levels and raise your risk of heart disease.
